authors.name: Laura  Smith
authors.affiliation: Department of Clinical and Movement Neurosciences, Queen Square Institute of Neurology, University College London (UCL)

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7215m","text":"Cells were lysed in 1% Triton X 100 lysis buffer with protease and phosphatase inhibitors. Cell lysates were electrophoresed with NuPage™ Bis-Tris protein gels. Proteins were transferred to a PVDF membrane, blocked in 10% milk and treated with primary and secondary antibodies in 5% milk. Antibody binding was detected using the GE Healthcare Amersham™ electro-chemi-luminescence (ECL)™ Prime Western Blotting Detection Reagent. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ru4e","text":"Make loading dye using NuPAGE Sample Buffer (4X) and Reducing agent (10X). For 18 µL  of sample, add 6 µL sample buffer and 1 µL reducing agent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fnci","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ai1dm","text":"Combine sample and loading dye and heat at 70 °C  for 10 minutes . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jfuh","text":"Prepare precast gel (NuPAGE) by removing comb and the tape at the bottom of the gel chamber. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8u10d","text":"Set up the gel chamber in the gel tank so that the well openings of the precast are facing inwards toward each other. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b7e46","text":"Fill the gel chamber with 250 mL((1X) NuPAGE MES running buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b4lgc","text":"Remove samples from heat and spin at 10K for 1 minute to collect any evaporated sample in bottom of tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6qvof","text":"Load samples into gel using hamilton pipette tips. Place protein ladder marker in the first or last well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abd8d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fltvj","text":"Run gel at 200V for 45 minutes or until the protein has migrated far enough into the gel. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fouk3","text":"Prepare Towin transfer buffer: 25 mM Tris, 192 mM glycine, pH 8.3, with 20% methanol (vol/vol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9sidg","text":"To prepare 1 L of buffer:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bokn5","text":"- 800 mL distilled H2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eraub","text":"- 200 mL methanol","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"12img","text":"- 3.03 g Tris base","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hf7t","text":"- 14.4 g Glycine","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94plj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"amjj2","text":"Soak PVDF membrane in methanol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8896s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4n534","text":"Soak transfer sandwich components (2 sheets of filter paper and 2 pads) in Towin transfer buffer until completely damp.  Use hands or roller to remove any air bubbles. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5l5ku","text":"Make up transfer sandwich in casette being careful to avoid trapping any air between layers. Layers should be 2 pads, 1 filter paper, gel, PVDF membrane, 1 filter paper and 2 pads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fa2e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c5vim","text":"Place cassette in transfer tank with transfer buffer and run for 1 hour at 30V. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c7k79","text":"Remove membrane from sandwich, noting the orientation relative to the gel to prepare for blocking.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9jlqo","text":"Block membrane in 10% semi-skimmed milk in PBS at room temperature for 1 hour.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6eaf","text":"Add desired primary antibody in 5% semi-skimmed milk in PBS and incubate with membrane for 1 hour at room temperature or 4°C over-night.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"jv02","text":"Wash membrane twice in 0.4% PBS-Tween.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c8ko0","text":"Add appropriate  HRP-linked secondary antibodies to 5% semi-skimmed milk (1:250) and incubate with membrane for. hour at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"avq8l","text":"Wash membrane three times in 0.4% PBS-Tween. Wash once in PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"773dp","text":"Incubate membrane with 2 mL GE Healthcare Amersham™ electro-chemi-luminescence (ECL)™ Prime Western Blotting Detection Reagent for 5 minutes and drain excess reagent.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fddin","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"beucb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bdcpa","text":"Develop blots using the Bio-Rad ChemiDoc imaging system (Bio-Rad) using the ‘chemi’ protocol with signal accumulation mode, calibrated to the signal intensities. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4lj9","text":"For analysis of alpha-synuclein, fix the membrane with 0.4% PFA and 0.01% (v/v) glutaraldehyde for 30 minutes prior to blocking. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Western blot (NuPAGE and MES buffer)
